1.Text: ...pha... Al...pha...
(Mnh... So sleepy...)
...lpha? ...Alpha?
(Who is it? Who's calling my name—)
Alpha? Please hurry up and collect your exam results.
Hm...mnh?
Exam...results?

Unable to make sense of the words, Alpha remains in
a daze as her teacher walks up to her.

My...how unusual for you, of all people, to doze off.
Did you pull an all-nighter studying?
...Wh-Where am I?

Where are you? You're in class. Honestly...we can't
have our highest-achieving student acting so
clueless.

Here are your test results. Another perfect score.
Very impressive.
Th-Thank you...
Alright, next is—

(My head feels fuzzy...as if I've forgotten
something...)

Alpha, are you okay? If you don't feel well, we can
visit the infirmary.

N-No...I'm fine. Thanks for your concern. I'm just
groggy after waking up.

What a relief. Glad to see you're back to your usual
cool self.
(My usual self...huh?)

(I should be...my usual self, but something feels
wrong. I need to calm down and get my facts
straight.)

(My name is...Alpha. I probably have the highest
grades and best looks of all the first years in this
school. I'm blonde with long ears, which I got from
my parents. As for the rest—)
Let's see. Last of all is...Zeta!
...Huh? She's not here. Is she absent again?

As the teacher gazes around the classroom, the door
at the back opens, and a lone female student enters.
Zeta, you're late again!
Sorry! My alarm didn't go off...

This is the tenth time this month already. Come on,
hurry up and get your exam results.
Okay.

Honestly...you're letting your good grades go to
waste. It would do you good to follow Alpha's
example.
Alright, alright, I will.

The student named Zeta says nonchalantly before
taking her seat, which happens to be next to Alpha.

(Is she...a delinquent? It seems she gets good grades
but doesn't have her act together. She's the complete
opposite of me, so I doubt we'd get along—)

Teach really ought to give me a pass... Don't you
agree, Alpha?
Huh?

It's not like I've been flunking the exams, so what's
the big deal about being late for class?
...I-Isn't that argument a bit extreme?

Seriously? You think so? Jeez, Alpha, you're such a
goody-two-shoes.

Faced with the pouting Zeta, Alpha averts her gaze
before replying.
(It looks like we're friends...)
After school...
Alpha! Let's go home together!
Y-Yeah, of course.
Hahah! Yay!

(She may not have her act together, but she doesn't
seem like the bad sort.)

(Besides, when I talk with her, I feel something akin
to nostalgia... Were we really close friends?)

By the way, after we went our separate ways yesterday,
I ran into some trouble with students from another
school.
Huh? Are you okay? Did you get hurt?

Oh, I'm fine. As usual, I gave them a beating and let
them know who's boss!
I-I see... You must be pretty strong, Zeta...
Heheh. I can hold my own when it comes to fighting!

(Sh-She seems more extreme than I expected...but she
gives me the warmest smile.)

(I'm not sure how to tell her that my memory is
suddenly unreliable, and she seems like the type
who would take it as a joke...)
...Hm? Alpha, hold on a second.
What's the matter? Why did you stop all of a sudden?
...Didn't you hear something coming from that way?
Zeta's gaze falls on a dimly lit back alley.
I'm curious... Let's take a slight detour!
Hey, w-wait!
Alpha follows Zeta into the back alley.

2.Text:
Curious about the noise coming from a back alley,
Zeta enters, followed by Alpha. There they find a
rectangular dumpster shaking noisily.
It sounds like it's coming from inside here.
Yes, it's pretty creepy...
It's shaking...a lot...
I wonder what's inside. Wanna try opening it?

Zeta...are you enjoying yourself...? I think we'd
best leave it be.

C'mon, it'll be fine! If things get bad, we can make
a run for it!
Hey, you're not listening—
Whoa! It's heavier than I expected! Hup!
The moment Zeta opens the lid of the garbage dumpster—
Ack?!

Previously standing beside Zeta, Alpha falls as if
pushed by "something" that leaped out of the
dumpster.
...Huh? Alpha?!
Oww... Something came out of nowhere...
It's on top of me... Is it a dog?

Oh boy, you saved me! As luck would have it, I got
stuck in there.
Y-You're welcome... Wait, you're a talking dog?!
No, I'm not a dog...
Alpha, are you okay?
Does anything about this situation look okay?

You're acting like a crazy person... Who're you
talking to?
Right, that other girl can't see me.
...Huh? You don't seem that easy to miss...

Heh... It's not like that. I can only be seen and
heard by those who touch me.

We'll fix this in no time. All I've gotta do is touch
her. There you go!

With that, the dog-like creature energetically jumps
onto Zeta.
Wha?! Wh-What's this weird sensation? A-A dog?!
Zeta roughly grabs the creature and lifts it.
What the hell is this?!

H-Hey! Could you not hold me by the neck?! It hurts!
It hurts real bad!

The creature slips out of Zeta's grasp and stands
before them.
There really is a talking dog...
Despite what you think, I'm no dog. I'm a spirit.
...Huh? A spirit?
That's right. I'm a spirit who goes by the name Nuru.

You see, there are beings living in a different
dimension from the two of you. That's why
you usually can't see or hear them.

But if I touch a being from another dimension, that's
a different story. My consciousness interferes with
whoever I touch, connecting channels between
dimensions that otherwise wouldn't intersect—

I could go on with complex explanations like this,
but, well, judging by your expressions, the two of
you aren't very interested, are you?
No.
Nope.

Honestly, kids these days... Just remember that if
you touch me, you can see things you otherwise
couldn't.

I mean, you can't expect me to accept that spirits
exist all of a sudden. That's something straight out
of a comic...

That is unless you can give me a proper explanation.
Since you're a spirit, not a dog, I'm willing to listen.
(Sounds like Zeta dislikes dogs...)

So why were you locked in a dumpster? Were you
scrounging for food or something?

Scrounging for food? How rude. I was searching for
Dark History.
Saying this, Nuru takes out a notebook.
...A notebook?

That seemed to come out of nowhere... Where did you
get it from?

That's confidential. More importantly, don't you feel
anything when looking at this notebook?
...It looks weird.
It has an eerie...haze around it.

Exactly. This is no ordinary notebook. It's the
creation of adolescence—"My Idea of the
Ultimate Protagonist Notebook."

Allow me to explain. This was the only treasure of a
child in the midst of adolescence, containing all his
desires and ideal scenarios in writing.
...I see. Nope, still clueless.
Do you mean it's like a book of ideas?

S-Sure, you could say something like that. Despite
its importance, as the writer grew older, he must
have abandoned it out of shame from the judging
gazes of those around him.

That's an oddly deep and specific explanation.
Anyway, I get what the notebook is now, but
what does it have to do with the eerie haze
surrounding it?
The eerie haze is the "desire" of its owner.

Zeta... Have you already lost interest? Well, I guess
I'm the weird one for asking serious questions...
Could you be a little more specific?

The owner threw away the notebook with an intense
desire for its contents not to be seen by anyone.
That desire resides in the notebook and negatively
affects its surroundings.
Hmm. Negatively affects it how?
(Oh, I guess that caught her attention...)

The lid of the dumpster was heavy because of the
negative effects of the notebook—the desire for its
contents to be seen by no one.

Now that I think about it, the dumpster's lid was
super heavy and hard to lift...

The physical effects are minor, but since I exist in
the same dimension as the desire, I was strongly
affected and unable to get out. Usually, slipping
through physical barriers is no trouble at all for me.

To sum it up, some things can become irreversible
if left unchecked. I call these phenomenons Dark
Histories.

And my mission is to remove Dark Histories and
prevent their negative effects on this world.
Whoa, that's kinda cool.

Oh, and when desires congregate in one place,
they can materialize as a collective entity called
an "evil spirit." Well, I'll spare you the details
since these rarely turn up.
So all you need to do is collect those?

No, it's necessary to remove the root cause.
The notebook is a problem in and of itself,
so I simply need to eradicate it.
Watch closely! I am...
...Atomic Fire.

The notebook suddenly catches fire and is eventually
reduced to cinders.

...I'm more surprised by that fire than any of that
weird story you made up earlier.
...Hey, something fell.

This is a Bone. It appears when Dark Histories
vanish. Guess you can call it proof of my work.
I collect these.

"I collect Bones..." That has a nice assassin-like
ring to it.
...So you are a dog, after all.
No! I told you I'm a spirit! How incredibly rude!
Anyway, we should be going...

Wait! I have a favor to ask the two of you!
...Could you help me with my work?
Seriously?
Seriously?

This case got me thinking that operating in this
world sometimes requires the help of others,
such as the two of you.

I doubt most people would believe a story like this,
so I can't just ask anyone for help. It must be fate
that I met the two of you! So would you please help
me? Please!

We didn't say we completely believe your story.
Isn't that right, Zeta?
Hmmm... I'll help.
Seriously?!
Zeta?!

Well, you're in trouble, right? I'll do what I can to
help out.

Besides, it sounds more fun than showing up for
classes.
You'd better prioritize going to class...
I'm counting on you, too! Pleeease?
Whaー?!

(I was prepared to say no, but I'm finding it
surprisingly hard to turn down the spirit's
request... Wait, am I...)
(...Am I a dog lover?)

Come on, Alpha! Let's do it together! Just think of
it as social studies!
*sigh* Fine, I'll help out as well.
Yay! That's the spirit, Alpha!

Yes, yes, thank you. I'll be counting on you.
...These kids are easy pickings.
What have I gotten myself into?

3.Text:
Alpha and Zeta meet the spirit Nuru, who tells them
of his mission to remove Dark Histories. The girls
decide to help Nuru.
So? How do we find these Dark Histories?

Don't tell me we have to rummage through each of the
dumpsters.

It's not always things we're looking for. What
matters most is solving people's problems at
their root—in other words, prevention.

You guys have smartphones, don't you? I want you to
find and install an app called "Darkollector."
(Smartphone? App?)
Darkollector, right? Lemme see... Oh, found it.

Wow, looks like it just came out, but it's got good
reviews, even a five-star rating. Guess it's safe to
install.

Heheh! It's an app that I co-developed with a friend.
We'll keep updating it with additional features.
It suddenly sounds super fishy...
(Do I have a device like that as well?)

Alpha reaches into her uniform pocket and finds the
same device Zeta is holding.
Is this...a smartphone? Um, install...app...
What's the matter, Alpha? You can't find it?
Huh? Umm...
Lemme take a look.
Just go here, and... Yup. Installed. There you go.

Th-Thanks... You're really good with these devices,
aren't you?
Well, I am a highschooler!
Is that supposed to be a good reason?

(People will think I'm weird if I don't know how to
use these devices... I'll look into it later.)
Looks like both of you managed to install it.
Huh? Is this some kind of social media app?

That's right. You can compare it to any of your
favorite social media platforms.

What makes Darkollector unique is that it's totally
anonymous. A hidden identity is a powerful thing,
making it far easier to post about topics that would
otherwise be difficult to discuss.

While all of us have things we'd like to hide, the
truth is that we all want to make our presence
known somewhere... There's a coolness to that
sort of edginess.

Basically, this app draws out people's true feelings
and narrows down posts by keywords. Then, by
extracting the sender's info, we admins can find
the source of the Dark History.
Whoa. So much for a privacy policy. That's awful.

W-We're not exploiting anyone! It's even written in
our terms and conditions. See?

Well, we've come this far. We'll just have to stick
it out and trust you, Nuru.
Oh, what about this post? It was made 5 minutes ago.

"I am one who endures loneliness... My right eye
itches today..."
...What is this? Some kind of cryptic message?

Hmmm... Those are exciting words for those in the
know. It's most likely a Dark History-related post!

Looks like it originated from...your school. Nice and
easy! Let's go check it out!
Well, I guess we can take a look.

The posted meeting place is a first-year classroom at
Alpha and Zeta's school. Peering in from the hallway,
they see a lone female student inside.

Is she the one who made the post? She's gazing out
the window up at the sky, but...

That girl... From what I remember, she stirred up
rumors after she suddenly started wearing an eye
patch a few weeks ago.

But she's been wearing it for a while now, so it
should be better by now. It could be pretty
serious, but...it's a bit weird.

That eye patch... That distant look... No doubt about
it, that's an Evil Eye.
An Evil Eye?

Yes, it's a phenomenon where you wake up one day and
realize you're special. I bet she's wearing a colored
contact lens beneath that eye patch.

Special? You mean like us being able to see weird
things?
It hurts when you put it like that...

Based on the content of her post, she appears to be
confronting her fate of being alone and is looking
for someone who understands her.

We'll need to get through to her and get her symptoms
under control. This time, I'll leave it to the two of you.
You're up next, Alpha.
...Huh?

Don't you remember my exploits at the back alley
dumpster?
I wouldn't necessarily call that exploits...

Hmm? If you're sure you can't do it, Alpha, I'll go
instead...
Wha?! I never said I couldn't do it. Leave it to me.
Whoa! Now that's the spirit!
So, what do I need to do?
Just tell her what she wants to hear.

...What? That's it? That's the only advice you have
for me? Could you be a little more specific?

Jeez, fine. It seems she's feeling a sense of loneliness.
You should try understanding her actions, words, and
deeds and have a heart-to-heart with her.

If you can build a bond and reach her heart,
it should lighten her worries.
Best of luck, Alpha!
In other words, befriend her... Fine, I'll give it a go.
Umm...how's your eye injury?
Huh?! Wh-Who is it?! Huh? Alpha?!
...N-No, I mustn't lose my cool...
...Heheh. It's complicated.

My eyes possess the power to see everything—the past,
the future...
You sound...delusional...
D-Delusional?!

Well, did you hit your head or something? Maybe you
should get it checked out...
Sh-Shut up! I'm fine, thank you!

Berated by the now red-faced girl, Alpha racks her
brain as she walks back into the hallway.
I have no idea what I did wrong...

That was a complete mess! How clueless can you be?
It's like you went out of your way to trigger her in
every way possible.

And you've made the situation worse than I ever
imagined. Things could get dangerous if you mess
up next time.

Alpha, I'm going to walk you through exactly what to
say. You must follow my instructions to the letter.
Wh-Wha...

The instructions Alpha receives make no sense to her,
but she decides to do exactly as she is told.
Um...

...You again? ...If you don't want to die, I suggest
you walk away immediately. Tsk... My right eye
itches...
As the girl presses her right eye, Alpha speaks...

*sigh* I did not think you would see through my
disguise.
What?
Y-You are one of the Awoken, are you not?
What a monotone delivery!
And she sounds so stiff... She's terrible at acting!
Are you...one as well?
I am s-sorry for testing you just now...

No, it's my fault for not seeing through your
disguise. I'm sorry for being rude earlier.

I-I...have finally encountered a kindred spirit.
I'll tell you my true name as a testament to our
contract. You...may call me Lucifer.
(...Lu-Lucifer?)

I've only revealed this name to you. So...if you'd
like, could you also tell me your true name?

(Huh? Nuru didn't tell me what to do in this
situation! Guess I'll have to improvise...)
My...My name...is Alpha...

...Alpha?! Heheh... Perhaps this is fate. You have
the same name as my sister, who I was separated
from in my previous life.
R-Right... What a coincidence.

Oops. It's nearly time for prep school. I have to go.
I'd love to talk more, but I must act the part. We'll
have a nice long chat next time, other Alpha.
My soulmate...

With a content look on her face, the girl walks out
of the classroom.
It...worked?
Yes! That was great! You've got this!
Hahah! Well done, Alpha!
You're messing with me, aren't you, Zeta?

*sigh* I'll be the one with a Dark History at this
rate.

Alpha sighs deeply, regretting her decision to help
out.

4.Text:
A few days have passed since the mysterious encounter
with Nuru. During Alpha's lunch break, she walks while
thinking about her memories.

(Hmm... The more I think about it, the stranger the
situation seems to be.)

(It's not like I've forgotten all my memories, but
I'm missing a large chunk of my past. It's as if...
it's always been this way.)

(I know where I live and how to get home, and I have
a good grasp of common sense. I never have any
trouble in class, either.)

(Even with my smartphone...I had some trouble with
it the other day, but I mastered it in no time once I
started using it. Although...maybe I just adapted
to it.)

(I can't seem to come up with an answer. Could it be
something external? Maybe I'm overthinking this—)

As Alpha continues to walk absentmindedly, she turns
the corner and bumps into someone.
Oh, sorry. I was lost in thought...

Standing before her is a very ordinary-looking male
student.

I'm the one who should apologize for not seeing you
there. Are you okay? Are you hurt anywhere, Alpha?
...Huh? No, I'm fine.
That's good to know. Well, I'll be going now.
With that, the boy scurries off.

I feel as if...I've met him somewhere. And how did he
know my name...?

Morning Alpha! What're you doing standing in the
hallway? Let's hurry up and get to class.

Zeta...morning. Yeah, you're right, although you're
the last one who should be telling me I'm late for
class...
Late again? It's almost the fourth period.

Well, I've just been sooo tired, I can't seem to get
up in the morning!

You seem to be brimming with energy. I'm pretty sure
you're just using that as an excuse for slacking off.
Ulp... As astute as ever, Alpha.

A-Anyway, did you see News Top yesterday? "Popular
idol Epsilon selected as brand ambassador for sports
drink Garderade!" Man, she's amazing!
Hey, don't try to change the subject.

...Actually, I saw that article as well. I've been
reading news sites a lot lately since you can
pick up a lot of different information from
one place.

Hahah. Why am I not surprised? If anyone's reading
all that complicated stuff, it's you.

Did you know Epsilon is a student at our school?
Apparently, she doesn't show up often because of
her work, but if I run into her, I totally plan on asking
for her autograph!

If you approach her with such obvious ulterior
motives, she'll never give it to you.
Get her autograph, or get wrecked! That's my motto!
Now you just sound crazy.
...Heheh.

Whoa! Did you just laugh, Alpha?! Who knows,
next, pigs will fly...

I-I'm capable of human emotions as well, just so you
know! Seriously...

(I feel like I can be myself when I'm with Zeta. Is
it because we talked a lot like this in my forgotten
memories?)

(But that doesn't mean I'm acting the way I did back
then. Zeta, who seems to have known me for a while,
is especially likely to notice...)

(I wonder if she thinks it's strange that I suddenly
talk differently. At the very least, I don't want to
cause trouble for Zeta after how nice she's been.
I'll choose my words a little more carefully, and—)
Hey, Alphaaa! Something bothering you again?
Oh, uh, wh-what makes you say that?

Well, you always seem deep in thought lately, so I
wondered if you were worrying about something.
(Sh-She's sharp...)
U-Um...

Unprepared to talk about her memories, Alpha quickly
asks a question that had been stuck at the back of her
mind.

I-I've just been wondering if people think my ears
and hair color are strange. You know, I'm a little
different from the others, right? Sometimes I worry
about how they see me...
Oh, that...
(Did I say something I shouldn't have?)

I totally get what you mean! Things like the chairs
and outfits everyone else uses and wears aren't
made for us at all!

My tail got caught in a train door the other day!
It was the fluffy bit, so I was fine, but that could've
been a lot more painful...

For me, trying to rush onto a train is a matter of
life and death—hey, are you listening, Alpha?

Y-Yeah. I'm just a little surprised you relate to me
so much...

Well, of course, I've been unhappy about it for a
looong time.

But I also think social development favors the
majority, so there isn't much we can do about it.

I mean, most sporting goods are only available for
right-handed people, and they mostly just stock
standard clothing sizes, right? That's just the way
the world works.

Anyway, I guess people's mindsets have started to
change recently! There seem to be more individuals
considering those of us who are somewhat different
from the norm.

You know, accessibility... No, that's not quite it.
Inclusivity? Not that, either...

Diversity... Jeez, I can't think of the right word!
C'mon, I sounded pretty smart until I messed up
there, didn't I?

Heheh. I never doubted how smart you are, Zeta, more
how seriously you take things. Anyway, you're not
coaxing a compliment out of me.
Tsk. Boring!

(If I think about it, there's nothing wrong with my life
now. Even the sense that I've forgotten something
almost feels as if it's just me overthinking things.)

(I can't ignore the mystery of my missing memory...
but it's nice having a lighthearted chat like this.)
Thanks, Zeta.
You're welcome.

By the way, where did that spirit go? ...Wait, I'm
not saying anything weird, am I?
Hahah! Not at all! Don't worry! I remember as well!

He said he wasn't gonna show up at our school if he
could help it. Something about not wanting to get in
the way of our springtime of youth...
What's that supposed to mean?
Who knows.

He seemed friendly enough but pretty free-spirited.
He'll probably show up whenever he needs us.
True...
Oh, that's right—

Are you free tomorrow? Since it's our day off, wanna
head into town for some fun?
...Into town?

Yeah! We ought to hang out together sometime.
I've picked out a few nice places we can visit.
I see... Sure.

Despite having made the request herself, Zeta
responds to Alpha's consent by stopping in her
tracks, her eyes wide with surprise.
What? Really?!
S-Sure, why not?

Whoa, no way! I thought you'd turn me down like you
usually do! Okay, I'll contact you later about the time
and place!

(I can't believe she's so excited about just hanging
out... Was I a bad friend?)
Really looking forward to tomorrow, Alpha!
Yes, me too.

Despite feeling unease at her memories, Alpha
embraces her current situation with a sense
of positivity.

5.Text:
It's their day off. Alpha arrives at the meeting
place a little early.
Hey! Here! Over here!
Morning, Alpha.
Morning, Zeta. Um...sorry. Did I keep you waiting?

No, I only just got here. Besides, it's still not the
time we agreed to meet.

I'm surprised you arrived earlier than me. I honestly
thought you'd be late.
Meanie... I'm only late when it comes to school.
Why are you only late for school?
Because it's boring? I'm never in the mood to go!

Besides, I need to make a good impression today,
so you'll have to hang out with me again!

This isn't a job interview... I'd prefer it if you
were more relaxed.

By the way, why are you wearing your school uniform
on your day off? ...Not that I'm one to talk.

I wasn't sure what to wear, so I settled on my school
uniform. For starters, it's tough balancing my tail
with regular outfits.
What's your excuse, Alpha?

(There were all kinds of outfits in my closet, but I
felt anxious about going out in something I wasn't
used to wearing.)
...I don't have many outfits for going out.

Wow, really? I thought you dressed up more.
Well, this is the only time we can wear school
uniforms, so let's enjoy it while we can! This
look is a privilege reserved for us students.

You have a point. There are only so many years in
one's life when one can be a proud student.
"One's life"? Talk about being dramatic!
Huh? Did I say something weird?

Not weird—just an interesting expression! You always
have a flair for the dramatic, Alpha.
I don't mean to...
I guess "always" is an exaggeration. "Sometimes."

Anyway, I'll take it from here! This way first...
Follow me!

Zeta takes Alpha to a chic cafe. The two enter and
order the same dessert.

Sorry to keep you waiting! This is our Fruit Waffles
Special. Enjoy!
Wow! These waffles are huge!

They're waffles with cream and fruit sandwiched in
between. Do you eat the waffles first or the cream
and fruit? It looks so good.

So you're saying...the onslaught of calories leads to
deliciousness?

Heheh. What's that supposed to even mean? Come on,
let's dig in.
Wait, hold on! We've gotta take photos first!

Zeta takes out her phone, turns it to the side, and
points it at her waffle.
...Yes! I got a nice shot!
Alright...me too...

(Heheh... I've studied up on my phone's camera
function, just in case something like this happened!)

(I found an article on a news site called "A Complete
Beginner's Guide to Smartphones for First-time Users"
and read every word of it!)

(Take the photo with the subject in the middle!
...Like this?)
Oh, did you take it? Lemme take a look.
Zeta snatches Alpha's phone from her.
...Ahahah! You suck at taking photos, Alpha!
Seriously?

It's out of focus, and your finger is in the frame!
Seriously, and you call yourself a high schooler?
Heheheh.

(Ack... Who knew there was such a thing as a good or
bad photo...)

Th-That was just practice! I'll take a proper
one now...

Jeez, I don't think I've ever laughed so hard before.
It's kinda reassuring to know there are some things
you're not good at, Alpha.
...I'm never showing you my photos again.
Sorry, sorry! I take it back!

After finishing their desserts while engaging in idle
chatter, the two head out for some clothes shopping.

Don't you think this dress would look good on you,
Alpha?

Huh? You're joking, right? It's so tight you'd be
able to see every curve.

But don't you think it'll look good on you? You've
got a great figure, so you ought to flaunt it!

I'd never look good in such a tight-fitting suit.
If you like it so much, why don't you try it on,
Zeta?
I can't! There's no hole for my tail!
Oh, you're right...
A top should be fine, right? How about this one?

...Whoa! Isn't the chest area way too revealing?!
I could never wear something so bold!

Oh, that's unfortunate. I went out of my way to
choose this one for you...
Don't try to guilt me into wearing it! Not happening!
Ahh, that was sooo much fun!

I can't believe it's this time already. It sure went
by fast. We should start heading home—
Hm? An app notification?

What's up? Oh, I also got one... Huh? It's a
notification from Darkollector.
It says, "Evil spirit detected. Launch app to check!"
An evil spirit—
Oh dear...nuru! An evil spirit has shown up...nuru!

Whoa! Seriously! You'll give me a heart attack
turning up out of nowhere like that...
Where have you been all this time, Nuru?
I was working, of course...nuru!
Why are you adding "nuru" to everything you say?

I thought I'd sound more endearing. You know, your
friendly neighborhood spirit. Or else I don't really
give off spirit vibes...I mean, spirit vibes nuru.
You already forgot to add it...
It's too late to try and change your vibe now.

Yeah, fine, I get it. I thought I'd make an effort to
sound more spirit-like, but I guess it was all for
nothing.

Anyway, about this "evil spirit," is that the thing
you mentioned last time?

That's right. I hadn't expected one to appear so
soon... You two are out of luck.

Go ahead and launch the app. The radar should show
you the evil spirit's location.

Let's see... Oh, you're right. It's showing an arrow
and something weird.

The arrow points toward the evil spirit, and the
thing next to it indicates its approximate strength
in size.

The problem is an evil spirit has to reach a certain
strength before it's detectable. We'll update this in
the future, but...since it's already a full-fledged
evil spirit, we're dealing with an emergency.
Is this really something we can handle?

Since it's only just been detected by the radar,
we should be able to handle it.

By the way...how are we going to handle it? It's not
like you can just listen an evil spirit's problems
away, right?

That won't work. Evil spirits are an amalgamation of
various thoughts and feelings. You can't talk sense
to them. The only solution is to eliminate them by
force.

It's a bit complicated, but I'll try to explain. Evil
spirits live in another world, just like us spirits.

Ordinary people can't see or touch them. Like me,
they exist on a different world channel, meaning
they pose no physical threat.
So what's the problem, then?

Since they are amalgamations of people's strongest
desires, they also amplify the subconscious desires of
those around them. So they're more likely to unleash
desires that are rationally suppressed.

A small example is when someone's appetite becomes
so unbearable they start snacking on grocery store
products or when someone gets so stressed they go
around destroying things.
Okay...

Hey! You're thinking it's not that big of a deal,
aren't you?! That was just a small example!

People can even get so influenced by comics that,
in an attempt to reincarnate into another world,
they jump in front of a truck or get mercilessly
beaten up by blunt objects.
...Are those really subconscious desires?

It's especially problematic when it affects
adolescent boys. They tend to be dreamers.

Now that you get the picture, let's hurry to its
location. With my powers and your assistance,
we should be able to handle it.

...Guess it's too late to back out now. Let's go,
Alpha.

...Yes, I guess you're right. I'm not sure we can help,
but we seem to be the only ones who know about
what's going on.

The two of them, accompanied by the spirit, head
toward the school indicated by the radar...

6.Text: ...Is there really an evil spirit here?

Schools are where people of the same age gather,
where there's no shortage of inspiration, and classes
are, in a sense, where you can have time to yourself.
I believe it's where fantasies best flourish.

It's in such places that evil spirits are most likely
to be born. Perhaps they were born here, or
perhaps they were drawn here.
Does no one pay attention during class?
I get your reasoning, but where is it in the school?

We'll need to switch over to the spirit channel.
Hold on to me, both of you!
The two grab aggressively onto Nuru.
H-Hey! Not my face! Watch the face—! *muffle, muffle*

Along with Nuru's voice, Alpha and Zeta are engulfed
in light before landing in a place similar to where
they had just been.

Seriously... Didn't your parents teach you it's rude to
go for the face?!
So...where are we? Everything looks the same to me.
...Meanie.

We've switched over to the spirit channel. It looks
like the same world, but what exists inside it is
different. It's hard to explain.

Umm, is it like joining a different server in an MMO
game?
Aha! Correct you are, Zeta.
Yeah! It sorta makes sense now.
(How is that supposed to make sense?)
Wait, what the heck is that?!
Groaaarrr...
I-It's huge!
I need you two to help me take down that thing.

W-Wait a minute! How are we supposed to take down
that thing?!

It's way different from fighting a human opponent...
Oh man...

You can't beat the evil spirit in your current state.
You can now see and touch it, but your fighting
abilities haven't increased.
That's why I need you two to "awaken."
"Awaken"?

I will "challenge" both of you, so speak the words as
they come to your mind.

Don't overthink it. Just speak from your heart, and
you'll be fine. Understood?
But...

Nuru looks at them with eyes more serious than ever.
They are warm yet piercing, burning with purpose.

Nuru speaks to them in a voice more serious than ever.
It vibrates with a power difficult to imagine coming
from his small form. His tone is earnest, with no
trace of deception.

His expression differs from his usual appearance.
Faced with the power radiating from Nuru, the two
nod in agreement.
...I'll do it.
...Me too.
Alright then, here goes—
Nuru turns towards Alpha.

"Child of heroes, are you prepared to walk alongside
me?"

The moment Alpha is asked this question, her heart
thumps in her chest. A surge of emotions wells inside
her, and she finds herself voicing them.

"If that's what you want, then I'll devote my life to
it."
*gasp* Huh?

Hearing Alpha's answer, the spirit turns his gaze to
Zeta.
"Do you want more power?"
"I want power...the power to hunt them down!"
Wha—?!
...Very well! This is your new power!
The words flow effortlessly from Alpha and Zeta.
As if they had known them all along.

Light gathers in Alpha and Zeta's hands. These energy
particles take on forms, transforming into two weapons:
a sword and a disc.
Wh-What the?

That's Eins, the Sword of Light, and Sechs, the Disc of
Light. They will be your strength.
I feel some kinda surge of power!

Yes, me too... It feels strangely reassuring, like a
final push to ready me for the fray of battle.
Flowery language at a time like this, Alpha?
I suggest directing that sassy energy at the enemy.

You seem to have resolved yourselves. No need for
further explanation, I take it?
Now then...go forth!
Understood! You bet!

7.Text:
Alpha and Zeta continue to inflict damage until the
evil spirit's body finally begins to stagger.
Alpha! Now!
Got it! Time for the finish!

Alpha leaps and swings her sword. Its sharp blade
slices through the evil spirit.

The damaged evil spirit begins to vanish. Its ominous
aura disperses as its body evaporates.
Whoa there! Now that's a big Bone. Time to collect!

After a brief silence, the weapons in Alpha and
Zeta's hands vanish into light particles.
...It's over...
Finally...
Good job, Zeta...
You too, Alpha... Oh...my body feels heavy...

You seem tired but not injured...so it's time we
switch back to the original channel.
Hold on to me, both of you. We're heading back.
Are we back?

...Yes, I think... There seem to be more people
around than in the other world.
The two look at each other before both collapsing.

I didn't think it would be this tough! That was
nothing like a normal fight...
...I don't normally fight.

Your moves were great, considering that.
It's incredible you can fight so well.
Are you actually an experienced fighter?
Absolutely not.

I would've handled things better if I had more
experience. I relied on you a lot, Zeta.

Anyway, we make for an incredible team! I think we're
perfect for each other. How about the two of us throw
hands next time?
Absolutely not.

Tsk. I thought we could invent an imaginary bone to
pick with each other.
"Bone to pick"? Are we talking about dogs again?
You know...never mind.

As Alpha and Zeta talk while gazing up at the sky,
Nuru peers at their faces.

Thanks again for all your hard work. Your mastery of
the weapons was brilliant. You've far exceeded my
expectations...

But it's not over yet. Small fissures will continue
to form, and an even larger evil spirit will likely
emerge next time.

You've convinced me of what you're capable of this
time around. You're the only ones I can rely on...
so...will you continue to help me?
Nope.
Huh?
Not unless we at least increase our numbers a little.
Um, sure.

The enemy is formidable, so we'll need to increase
our fighting power.
Yup, yup!

And we need a base of operations as well as the
necessary funds!
I-I'm not sure I can guarantee that...

A-Alright! Now that you're on board, I'll do...
something about increasing our personnel.

Alpha will communicate her requests, intent on doing
everything she can. She feels a surge of enthusiasm
for what the future holds.

However, she is unable to dispel her fatigue as her
vision wavers.
Ah...

Her eyelids slowly become heavier. She cannot resist.
Nuru and Zeta's voices gradually grow more distant.
The final bit of conversation she hears is—

Also, let's see...if we're going to recruit more
people, we'll need a name for our organization...

A name for our organization? It's gotta be something
cool!
Hmmm... The name of our organization will be—
...dow Garden.
*gasp*
Oh, you're awake?

It's rare to see you doze off in a place like this.
Were you tired?
Err, umm...Cid?
Yup...but why do you sound so unsure?

Wait, maybe I have some slime left on my face? Or is
something wrong with my hair?

No...it's not that. My mind feels groggy as if I've
just woken up from a very long dream.
A dream? What was it about?
...I don't remember.

Well, dreams are strange, aren't they? I often don't
remember what I dreamt about after I wake up,
but I'll vaguely recall having fun.

Right... I feel like it was a fun and magical dream.
I hope I can dream about it again.

Although Alpha cannot remember anything about her
dream, she feels an unmistakable passion stirring
within her heart. She smiles quietly, hoping one day
she will recall it.
